## createSafeExecutor() function

Creates a safe executor function that wraps the provided function. The returned function will execute the provided function and return a result indicating whether the execution was successful or if an error occurred.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function createSafeExecutor<T extends Fn.Callable, E = unknown>(fn: T): SafeExecutor<T, E>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

fn


</td><td>

T


</td><td>

The function to be executed safely.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

[SafeExecutor](./toolkit.safeexecutor.md)<!-- -->&lt;T, E&gt;

A function that executes the provided function safely.

## Example


```ts
const safeParse = createSafeExecutor(JSON.parse);

safeParse('{ "key": "value" }'); // { ok: true, data: { key: "value" } }
safeParse('invalid json'); // { ok: false, error: SyntaxError }
```
